data.title: Tin Star season 2 cast: Who plays Pastor Johan? Who is John Lynch?
data.meta_description: TIN STAR season 2 features John Lynch from The Fall in its cast. But who is John Lynch, the actor who plays Pastor Johan Nickel in Tin Star, and what else has he been in?
data.text:
Tin Star season two: A look at Jim's path

Tin Star season two, which is currently airing on Sky Atlantic and streaming on NOW TV, sees Anna Worth (played by Abigail Lawrie) hide from her family in the house of Pastor Johan Nickel (John Lynch). Pastor Johan is an ammonite preacher with a few deadly secrets. John Lynch, the actor who plays Pastor Johan, is best known for his role as Jim Burns in BBC’s The Fall. Tin Star viewers on Sky, however, may also know him for The Secret Garden, Sliding Doors and In the Name of the Father.

Who plays Pastor Johan in Tin Star?

Pastor Johan Nickel is played by Irish actor John Lynch.

Lynch, 57, got his start in Irish language plays at school during the early days of the Troubles.

He has appeared so far in his acting work a number of times on film, most famously alongside Daniel Day-Lewis and Emma Thompson in the Oscar-winning In the Name of the Father, the story of the Guildford Four.

Other films Lynch has made about Northern Irish history include 1984’s Cal, 1992’s The Railway Station Man and 1996’s Some Mother’s Son.

In fact, Cal was his big-screen debut, in which he played a man linked to the IRA who falls in love with a woman (Helen Mirren) whose husband was killed by the group.

TIN STAR SEASON 2 RELEASE DATE, CAST, TRAILER, PLOT

The film also netted him his only BAFTA nomination for most outstanding newcomer to film.

His first TV role came in documentary series Ten Great Writers of the Modern World in 1988, in which he played Stephen Dedalus, James Joyce’s character from Ulysses and A Portrait of the Artist as a Young Man.

The early 1990s were a busy time for the actor, in which he appeared in sci-fi films (Hardware, 1990), TV comedies (All Good Things, 1990 and Making Out, 1990 to 1991) and Derek Jarman’s adaptation of Christopher Marlowe play Edward II in 1991.

Lynch will be familiar to a generation of kids for his role as Lord Archibald Craven in classic literary adaptation The Secret Garden.

In that same year, he was fourth-billed in In the Name of the Father, which was nominated for seven Oscars.

HOW MANY EPISODES ARE IN TIN STAR?

Invalid email

He worked solidly in films throughout the rest of the 1990s, though his most famous role from this time after In the Name of the Father is probably the Gwyneth Paltrow ‘what if’ drama Sliding Doors.

In this film, he plays the bad boyfriend who, in one of the films two timelines, Gwyneth finds in bed with his ex-girlfriend.

The following year, he played iconic footballer George Best in the biopic of his life Best.

Lynch continued to work solidly over the next decade in TV projects like Bleak House and Spooks, films like The Bridge of San Luis Rey and the 2005 version of Lassie and TV movies like The Yellow House, in which he played artist Paul Gauguin.

In 2008, he appeared in the BBC’s version of The Passion following the last few days of Jesus Christ according to the Bible.

HOW TO WATCH TIN STAR ONLINE

This was the first of a number of Biblical roles for Lynch, who also appeared as the Angel Gabriel in 2010’s The Nativity, 2015’s Killing Jesus and as Aquila is 2018 film Paul, Apostle of Christ.

2013 saw him take his most famous role, Jim Burns in the Fall, in which he appeared in all 17 episodes of the BBC drama.

Other recent projects include drama The Terror, The Trials of Jimmy Rose and Michael Morpurgo adaptation Private Peaceful as well as Tin Star, where (spoiler alert) his character meets a nasty end.

Tin Star airs Thursdays on Sky Atlantic
